channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How To Maximize (And Minimize) Technology To Boost Sustainability
item.description: Balancing leveraging technology for more sustainable operations with leaning on energy-consuming digital tools and processes can be a complicated challenge.

item.title: Anonymity and Bugs Bunny
item.description: I came across this (ironically) anonymous quote recently: “The offline world is full of sticks, but the internet only has carrots.” When we come together in groups, it can bring out the best in people. When those groups are anonymous, porous and transient, though, the opposite can happen. And mobs never helped anyone, ever.

item.title: New Vertigo 70mm Print Headlines “Big & Loud” Season At New York’s Paris Theater
item.description: For fans of 70mm film New York is the place to be this weekend as the ‘Big & Loud’ season returns to The Paris Theater in Manhattan.

item.title: Non-professional writers
item.description: Nobody asks you to design a bridge, write a sonnet or do open heart surgery. We leave these essential tasks to trained professionals. But many job descriptions carry the unstated addendum, “and write.” Write memos, proposals, and even instruction manuals. The local supermarket is reducing its hours for the summer (well deserved). The sign they […]

item.title: Rembrandt Created His Own Gold-Like Paint For The Night Watch
item.description: Researchers at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam used chemistry methods to learn how Rembrandt mixed different pigments to create a realistic color gold in The Night Watch.

item.title: The prevailing conditions
item.description: It doesn’t matter how hard you try, you’re not going to change the direction of the wind. That doesn’t mean you can’t get good at sailing, though. And yes, if we do try, we can change the conditions in our household, community or workplace. It might feel like wind, but it’s caused by us and […]

item.title: Beats Studio Pro Just Gained A New Audio Feature: How To Get It
item.description: If you have a pair of Beats Studio Pro headphones, they’ve suddenly gained a new, more sociable, listening feature.

item.title: The landlord and the creative coach
item.description: The conflict is real. “Jean-Michel [Basquiat] called,” Mr. Warhol wrote in his diary on Sept. 5, 1983. “He’s afraid he’s just going to be a flash in the pan. And I told him not to worry, that he wouldn’t be. But then I got scared because he’s rented our building on Great Jones and what […]

item.title: NIST Ratifies Quantum Safe Algorithms Co-Developed By IBM Research
item.description: The new algorithms have now been approved by the US NIST for use.

item.title: In defense of the hard parts
item.description: Yesterday’s post was a little glib. Without a doubt, we add more value when we focus on the emotional labor of important work, leaving others the chance to create commodities. But the repetitive, difficult nature of leaning into commodity production can give us insight, humility and skill. It helps us understand just how hard the […]
